lines.dialogueText: After testing his rod, William set out for the Falling Leaves Dam —determined to find the strange fish his friend had told him about.
When he arrived at the dam, William asked the locals about the rumored strange fish. Oddly enough, most of them claimed to know nothing about it...
or perhaps, they were simply avoiding the question.
Time passed, but William still found no answers. He began to think the rumor might have been false and was about to give up on finding the strange fish.
But just before heading back, he noticed a small fish shop standing alone by the roadside. He decided to step inside — one last time — to ask about it.
[Door bell sound]

Oh… a new customer.
Welcome.
Is there something I can help you with?

I just wanted to ask you something.
Do you happen to know anything about the strange rumor going around this area?
A strange fish, you say… Oh, you must be talking about the one they call Six-Eyed Fish, aren’t you?
Six-Eyed Fish?
Yes… that fish lives deep down in the darkest part of the Evergreen River, near the Falling Leaves Dam.

But judging from your gear… it doesn’t seem nearly enough to catch the Six-Eyed Fish.
How about letting me help you, dear customer?
(He’s probably just trying to sell me something… better get out of here while I can.)

Oh, I’m not just trying to sell you something, dear customer.
I’m merely offering… a trade.
…A trade?

If you happen to catch any fish from the river, you can bring them to me.
I’ll pay you a good price for them.
And of course, if you ever need new gears — or want your equipment upgraded — I can handle that too. So… what do you say, dear customer?

Alright then, that sounds fair enough.
Let’s call it a trade for the information you gave me.
Splendid, dear customer! In that case, I wish you the best of luck in catching the Six-Eyed Fish.
(He’s definitely suspicious… but he’s the only lead I’ve got right now. Alright, time to find that strange fish.)
Thanks for the info, shopkeeper.
